backend/main.mo: Defines an empty Motoko actor, serving as a placeholder backend canister with no exposed methods.
feature_evidence.json: Machine-readable report mapping implemented Valentine UI features to source files, components, test IDs, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries describing the purpose of key frontend files such as App.tsx, global CSS, and Tailwind configuration.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS base file defining extensive CSS variables for light/dark themes, layout tokens, and default background and text styles.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point that sets metadata, page title, and mounts the React application at the root element.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React component implementing the Valentine prompt UI, evasive No button logic, Yes confirmation flow, and final meme display with romantic styling.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook that creates and caches a backend actor using React Query, handling authenticated and anonymous identities and invalidating dependent queries on change.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Authentication context and provider for Internet Identity, managing login state, identity persistence, and integration with the Dfinity AuthClient.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS file defining a romantic pink-and-white design system with custom OKLCH color tokens, dark mode variants, and utility classes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Frontend bootstrap file that renders the React app, wiring up React Query and Internet Identity providers and importing global styles.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration enabling class-based dark mode, scanning frontend source files, and extending the theme with custom containers, fonts, shadows, animations, and a large set of OKLCH-based design tokens (including romantic and sidebar color palettes).
project_state.json: Machine-readable snapshot of the projectâ€™s requirements and progress, describing a romantic Valentine single-page web app with Yes/No interactions, theming, and static meme asset handling, plus pending feature requests and image requirements.
